Comments_List: We explored different theoretical approaches to 'context' in the traditions of philosophy of language and formal linguistics. We then explored different empirical problems, putting those approaches to test, and finally arrived to the conclusion that we needed a dynamic semantics approach to have a proper treatment of some phenomena.
I very much enjoyed learning about approaches to language from a philosophical perspective. It helped me understand some core concepts in semantics and the discussions were extremely helpful.
The course is excellent, I cannot think right now of a way of improving it.

I enjoyed the small size of the class, which encouraged good discussions. Sometimes, the number of readings was too much to keep up with, and I am glad Zoltan always provided some background and context to the readings. The handouts were very helpful as well!
Yes, specially is you are interested in the interaction between language and philosophy (especially philosophy of meaning).
